summary: This is an FAA aircraft registration statement for PLAN D, LLC, a limited liability company organized in the U.S. Virgin Islands, used to register an aircraft. The document lists Jeffrey E. Epstein as a member and Lawrence Visoski as the manager, indicating Epstein's involvement in aviation assets through corporate entities.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a member of PLAN D, LLC, with U.S. citizenship verification marked, indicating his ownership interest in the aircraft-registering company.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.context: Identified as the manager of PLAN D, LLC, who signed the registration statement on behalf of the company.

connections.description: Epstein is a member of PLAN D, LLC, and Visoski is the manager of the same LLC, indicating a business/employment relationship.

events.title: Formation of PLAN D, LLC
events.description: The limited liability company PLAN D, LLC was lawfully organized in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Filing
events.description: The statement in support of registration of a U.S. civil aircraft in the name of PLAN D, LLC was signed and accepted by the FAA.

keyFacts: PLAN D, LLC was organized in the U.S. Virgin Islands on October 19, 2012, and used to register a U.S. civil aircraft.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is listed as a member of PLAN D, LLC, with U.S. citizenship verification confirmed.
Lawrence Visoski is identified as the manager of PLAN D, LLC and signed the registration document.
The document was filed with the FAA Aircraft Registry in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, and accepted on March 31, 2017.
The registration emphasizes that the LLC must meet U.S. citizenship requirements for aircraft registration, with at least 75% voting interest controlled by U.S. citizens.
